# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"(\s+|[.?!])")
    lines = String[]
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = String(word)
        else
            line *= word * " "
        end
    end

    push!(lines, line)
    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
wrap_string("This is a very very very very very very long string that needs to be wrapped at text_width=10")
```

Output:

```julia
"This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped\n at text_width=10\n\nThis is a very long string that needs to be wrapped\n at text_width=10"
```
